verses.text: And king Solomon reigned over Israel.
And these \add are\add* the princes which he had; Azarias son of Sadoc.
Eliaph, and Achia son of Seba, scribes; and Josaphat son of Achilud, recorder.
And Banaeas son of Jodae over the host; and Sadoc and Abiathar \add were\add* priests.

And Ornia the son of Nathan \add was\add* over the \f + \fr 4:5 \fl Gr. \ft appointed ones. \f* officers; and Zabuth son of Nathan \add was\add* \f + \fr 4:5 \fqa Heb. and \fl Alex. \ft insert 'priest.' \f* the king's \f + \fr 4:5 \fl Or, \ft companion. \f* friend.
And Achisar was steward, and Eliac the \add chief\add* steward; and Eliab the son of Saph \add was\add* over the family: and Adoniram the son of Audon over the tribute.
And Solomon had twelve officers over all Israel, to provide for the king and his household; each one's turn came to supply for a month in the year.
And these \add were\add* their names: Been the son of Or in the mount of Ephraim, one.
The son of Dacar, in Makes, and in Salabin, and Baethsamys, and Elon as far as Bethanan, one.
The son of Esdi in Araboth; his \add was\add* Socho, and all the land of Opher.
All Nephthador \add belonged to\add* the son of Aminadab, Tephath daughter of Solomon was his wife, one.

Bana son of Achiluth \add had\add* Ithaanach, and Mageddo, and \add his was\add* the whole house of San which was by Sesathan below Esrae, and from Bethsan as far as Sabelmaula, as far as Maeber Lucam, one.
The son of Naber in Raboth Galaad, to him \add fell\add* the lot of Ergab in Basan, sixty great cities with walls, and brazen bars, one.
Achinadab son of Saddo, \add had\add* Maanaim.
Achimaas \add was\add* in Nephthalim, and he took Basemmath daughter of Solomon to wife, one.
Baana son of Chusi, in Aser and in Baaloth, one,
Josaphat son of Phuasud \add was\add* in Issachar.
Semei son of Ela, in Benjamin.
Gaber son of Adai in the land of Gad, \add the land\add* of Seon king of Esebon, and of Og king of Basan, and one officer in the land of Juda.

\vp 27\vp* And thus the officers provided king Solomon: and \add they execute\add* every one in his month all the orders for the table of the king, they \f + \fr 4:20 \fl Gr. \ft change. \f* omit nothing.
\vp 28\vp* And they carried the barley and the straw for the horses and the chariots to the place where the king might be, each according to his charge.
And these \add were\add* the requisite supplies for Solomon: in one day thirty measures of fine flour, and sixty measures of fine pounded meal,
and ten choice calves, and twenty pastured oxen, and one hundred sheep, besides stags, and choice fatted does.
And the Lord gave understanding to Solomon, and very much wisdom, and enlargement of heart, as the sand on the seashore.
And Solomon abounded greatly beyond the wisdom of all the ancients, and beyond all the wise men of Egypt.
And he was wiser than all \add other\add* men: and he was wiser than Gaethan the Zarite, and \add than\add* Aenan, and \add than\add* Chalcad and Darala the son of Mal.
And Solomon spoke three thousand proverbs, and his songs were five thousand.
And he spoke of trees, from the cedar in Libanus even to the hyssop which comes out through the wall: he spoke also of cattle, and of birds, and of reptiles, and of fishes.

And all the nations came to hear the wisdom of Solomon, and \add ambassadors\add* from all the kings of the earth, as many as heard of his wisdom. \f + \fr 4:34 \ft Here the chapter ends, according to \fqa Heb. and \fl Alex.\f* And Solomon took to himself the daughter of Pharao to wife, and brought her into the city of David until he had finished the house of the Lord, and his own house, and the wall of Jerusalem. Then went up Pharao the king of Egypt, and took Gazer, and burnt it and the Chananite dwelling in Mergab; and Pharao gave them as a dowry to his daughter the wife of Solomon: and Solomon rebuilt Gazer.
